title: The sad truth about YoloQueue
body:
Someone just said this in the lobby and it's sad how true it is, it's not how you play it's how the rest of your team plays.
Everyone is at their rank because of the teams they have been matched with, not because of their skill level. Playing "higher" than your division doesn't gain you ELO, getting decent teams that also play well gains you ELO. 

YoloQueue is literally gambling, it's no wonder it's so addictive

replies.body:
No it's not.

Boosting exists, therefore your point is invalid.

If you can be boosted by another player then another player can drag you down. 
Logic.

Fact is playing at a higher standard then your MMR (or the MMR of the account) means you will rise, boosters are proof that having a team of feeders makes no difference, cause they will still win at a rate of 90%+ on accounts they are boosting, very few games are unwinnable if your actually playing to win rather then playing to not lose.

Actually until you get to high elo this point is incredibly true.

Lower level players do not understand their limitations and therefore will keep putting themselves in dangerous areas trying to outplay their enemy so they keep feeding throughout the game and that is the effect of snowballing.

This will happen tenfold at lower level over higher levels. I would like to be at a higher level so the enemy can't 1 shot me with 1 ability due to them going 15-0 at 15 mins.

I have to rely on my team not to feed profusely in order to have any impact mid-late game.

Everyone who says otherwise does not have the knowledge or experience.

Boosters just play stupid carry roles that low elo do not know how to stop.

99% of bronze players deserve to be there and the other 1% get completely dismissed because of the other 99% who claim they are better than they are.

If people used logic to dictate what they do and not emotions then we would have reached a very high level meta by now one that was not even set by the professionals.

I currently have a 70%+ win ratio with ashe and jinx both of which I focus primarily on cs above all else. Since at low elo they take all kills possible from the carries. This happens on both sides making cs a more effective path to take for me.
Until you get to high Elo, this is false.
